###

SESSION 1

Date - 16/09/2020 20.00 IST

Description

This lecture introduces concepts of regression. It will cover Linear regression and k-Nearest Neighbours regression in detail.

SESSION 2

Date - 19/09/2020 18.30 IST

Description

This lecture primarily deals with a few more key regression concepts. We revisit regression using Mutli-linear regression and Polynomial Regression. You will learn how to work with efficiently data with an introduction to validation!

HOMEWORK 1

  • RELEASE DATE - 19/09/2020 23:59 IST
  • DUE DATE - 26/09/2020 17:00 IST

WEEK 2

SESSION 3

Date - 23/09/2020 20.00 IST

Description

This lecture dives into inference learning. The lecture will explain the role of model selection and inference in linear regression. We learn the importance of cross-validation.

SESSION 4

Date - 26/09/2020 18.30 IST

Description

This lecture predominantly deals with regularization. We will understand what regularization is? Why is it needed? And types of regularisation. We will take a close look at Lasso and Ridge regularization.

HOMEWORK 2

  • RELEASE DATE - 26/09/2020 23:59 IST
  • DUE DATE - 03/10/2020 17:00 IST

WEEK 3

SESSION 5

Date - 30/09/2020 20.00 IST

Description

This lecture kicks off with Logistic Regression for classification and its loss function. We’ll understand how Logistic regression works and its associated functions. We’ll revisit mutli-linear and polynomial regression. The key concept of a loss function for logistic regression is introduced. We’ll also learn about decision boundaries.

SESSION 6

Date - 02/10/2020 18.30 IST

Description

This lecture revisits the concept of regularization and gives details about multi-class log regularization. The key concept of metrics is talked about here. we take a closer look at different metrics. The issue of data imbalance is explained.

HOMEWORK 3

  • RELEASE DATE - 03/10/2020 23:59 IST
  • DUE DATE - 10/10/2020 17:00 IST

WEEK 4

SESSION 7

Date - 06/10/2020 20.00 IST

Description

This lecture begins with neural networks. This is part one of the two part neural network lecture. We’ll start with the basics - what is a perceptron and then slowly building up to Multilayer Perceptrons. Anatomy of neural networks and design choices of neural networks is explained in detail.

SESSION 8

Date - 09/10/2020 18.30 IST

Description

This final lecture marks the end of the neural network series. This lecture demystifies Neural Networks, unraveling the geometric intuition behind them. We’ll use layers to develop the concept of back-propagation.

PROJECT

  • RELEASE DATE - 10/10/2020 23:59 IST
  • DUE DATE - 17/10/2020 17:00 IST

WEEK 5

PROJECT WEEK
